On the navigation of the St. Lawrence. States there is a sum available from duty on rafts and inquires where the impediments to navigation are.

Relative to the progress of his mission to England. The letter is long and interesting.

Petition of John Barnhart for land.
Report on the petition of B. Vanderburgh, from G. Powell.
Is constantly occupied on matters relating to Canada. Speaks of the desire of the ministers for the union of the provinces. Has been asked to report on a plan for calling a united parliament.
Enclosed: Certificate in favour of John Adamson, signed by Josias Taylor, Roderick Matheson, and John Watson, Justices of the Peace.
Petition of William Chisholm on behalf of sundry inhabitants of a new settlement in Halton County. Regarding settlement regulation.

States he has forwarded all packets received on the ship Nestor.
Concerning Gifford's petition on the navigation of the St. Lawrence.
A letter without any signature, concerning the development of the town of Adolphus. The writer is apparently a naval officer, very much opposed to American influence.
